creator: mccormick_bradford@emc.com
text:
I try to start tomcat on a solaris IPv6-only machine, and it does not start.  It
does start on dual-stack solaris machines.

Here is the uname-a output for the machine:
SunOS ic-eye 5.9 Generic_117171-17 sun4u sparc SUNW,UltraAX-i2

Here is the catalina.out log:

creator: mccormick_bradford@emc.com
text:
I started tomcat with startup.sh in the tomcat/bin directory.  I was running as
root.

creator: mccormick_bradford@emc.com
text: I was also able to reproduce this problem with tomcat 5.5.25

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
This could be bug 43588. Could you try 6.0.16 and see if you have the same
problem. If it is fixed, I'll look at porting the patch.

creator: mccormick_bradford@emc.com
text:
I can't find 6.0.16 -- the current download seems to be 6.0.14.  Where is
6.0.16?  Thank you much for your help. (Please excuse my ignorance.)

creator: mccormick_bradford@emc.com

Looks like 6.0.14 had the same problem:

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
It hasn't been released yet - the release vote is still running on the dev list.
You can get the release candidate from
http://people.apache.org/~remm/tomcat-6/v6.0.16/

This should not be used in a production environment. If it works and you want to
use it, wait until the formal release which should be early next week and grab
it from the official download then.

creator: mccormick_bradford@emc.com
text:
I tried 6.0.16, and it did not seem to fix the problem.

creator: mccormick_bradford@emc.com
text:
I tested tomcat on Linux (2.6.9-5.ELsmp #1 SMP Wed Jan 5 19:30:39 EST 2005 i686
i686 i386 GNU/Linux), and tomcat 5.5.17 did not work, but tomcat 6.0.16 does
work. So my problem exists on Solaris (5.9, 5.10) using tomcat 6.0.16; the
problem exists on Linux using tomcat 5.5.17; and the problem does not exist on
Windows using tomcat 5.5.17 (all testing on IPv6only machines).

creator: fhanik@apache.org
text:
this was fixed fairly recently, the code now executes (in 6.0.16)
InetAddress.getByName("localhost").getHostAddress()

this means, that your machine must have "localhost" as a valid address.

could it be that on your solaris, it doesn't resolve to anything, or resolves to
an ipv4 address?

Filip

(In reply to comment #9) Filip, I am not a UNIX sysadmin.  Can you kindly tell
me what I need to check for and/or change on my Solaris system?  Thank you much.
creator: mccormick_bradford@emc.com
fhanik@apache.org
text:
I'd post a question on tomcat-user mailing list, you might get some good solaris
gurus there

creator: markt@apache.org
text: Three weeks and no response. I am going to close this as invalid on the assumption it is an OS configuration issue. Please feel free to re-open if this is not the case.
